General course objectives:
General course objectives
Through participation in a research project in a shorter period of time, the student will try to answer a question or solve a problem, which is connected to the work of the supervisor. The student will also gain general competencies, e.g. the ability to participate in a constructive mentor-mentee relationships and the ability to communicate science â€“ in writing as well as orally.
To provide competences in experimental work within power electronics an/or IC design.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Plan and carry out a sequence of experiments with a tight time schedule
Work with an open problem within power electronics and IC design
Work in the lab with safety in focus
Participate constructively in a research team
Use equipment and methods in a qualified manner and account for the operational principles
Account for the theoretical background / physics behind the experiments
Analyse experimental data based on relevant theory
Account for and discuss experimental sources of error
Write a brief and precise commented lab-journal that makes the results useful also to the other team members
Orally communicate the main features of a scientific issue
Communicate the results of a scientific project in a report shaped like a scientific article
Constructively participate in a student-supervisor relationship.
Content:
Participation in a short-term research project in close collaboration with a supervising PhD student. The exact content of the project will be further agreed upon with the supervising PhD student. The main points of the scientific issue must be communicated orally. The project must be communicated via a final, written report.
The course is an experimental project, and the content of the project is strongly related to the ongoing research within power electronics and/or IC design.
Remarks: Registration requires an agreement about a project with a supervisor within power electronics and/or IC design at DTU Electro.
